Half life 1 is a game from 1998, in that times a revelutonary game with a nice story, good fights and awesome graphics, well in that time at least. Now 22 years later, it..... lets get straight to the point, it is just bad, graphics are not even toaster alike, to the point where u actually need to find me a PC wich can NOT run it. The gameplay is too easy, the levels give you no challenges, the midbosses and final boss are no problem and the story is poorly told/just too short. Sometimes u encounter bugs(i get it, every game has them) but i feel like i encounterd bugs very often in hl1 in comparisin that it has this short playtime. I cant recommend anyone playing it if they want to have geniuine fun for getting in the hl franchise, for that i can only recommend the hl1 remake "black mesa" wich tells the same story in a better way with better graphics, longer and more challenging gameplay, and just an overall better game.

Coming from games like TF2, and Quake, I initially had a hard time going through this game. Half-Life 1 is not a game where you just run and shoot. Instead, if you want to complete the game without savescumming, you have to pause for a moment, and plan out your actions accordingly. When I had realized this, the game got alot more fun, and alot more interesting.

Cannot say it didn't have it's good parts, but MAN is the platforming bad, mostly cause of weird control while in the air.
Would've made this game a thousand times better if they had either cut out the platforming or at the very minimum, removed Lambda Core, cause boy howdy that level is the bane of my entire existence.
"Go through this level that consists of unlabeled portals that don't tell you what they do or where they lead to, just jump in and pray to god you don't get fucked!" is the real catchy slogan for that level, not to mention that there are parts in the alien levels that really get on my nerves as well.
I see why it's considered a classic, but it has some real irritating flaws that should've been ironed out before being released.
Overall, I'd say it's a 6.5/10. It's all right, but really knows how to grind my gears.
For being an old ass game, it still holds up and is one of valves greatest masterpieces that set the base for the rest of valves quality games.

What more can be said about this game, Valve is like an unstoppable force of quality and the first time people realised that was with this game. This is seriously the first real attempt at " Story Driven Video Games" Half life was a game changer that anyone practiced in the game industry knows about and likes. Half life gets its reputation deservedly, and many many games like to take inspiration from it, like listening to a war veterans stories and writing a book about it. 

The game generally was instrumental in its release era, it threw tons of interesting puzzles and ideas at you and told you to get used to them, you spent a long while trying to find a solution and when you do it feels great, the plot is serious and interestingly original, gordon freeman has a great design, a great feel to him, like he deserves to be where he is and know s how to operate things like the energy weapons. The alien and enemy designs are fun and creative, the atmosphere can scare talibans out of their bomb vests. The underwater parts were frightening and pisspants thriller. The gunplay is solid and satisfying, the Nihilanth Boss fight is god teir with its level design and the ending is god damn wonderful.

There is no such thing as perfection, however, and there were some small issues i have to nitpick, sadly.
The flashlight kinda sucks, its lighting is weird in a way that its more like a concentrated beam of light than a torch, its better than the Opposing Force expansions goggles but still, the AI is clunky, bots that you need to progress need alot of handholding to get where you want, the enemies are really solid for the most part, except for the occasional steph curry perfect grenade throws and those aliens that shoot homing missiles that hit you through walls and stuff. The Xen Climax was also pretty unfair and clunky, i think it was Interloper with the fucking platforming bit that forced you to fly up in the air and inevitably die from fall damage, fuck interloper.

Get this game with the valve bundle to get every valve game. The Half life series is legendary and no valve-made half life game has failed to amaze the time it was released, who the fuck knows WHATS gonna happen after Alyx but considering Half lifes roots as one of the best gane series of all time, all we can do is patiently wait for the next video game revolution
